Point/Section 1: Description of How Quantum Computers Work
 
Quantum computers are based on the principles of quantum mechanics, which allows them to perform computations that far exceed the capabilities of traditional computers. In essence, these machines utilize particles like qubits (quantum bits) instead of regular bits; this means that as opposed to conventional computing, the values of qubits can be in a state of both 0 and 1 at the same time. This phenomenon enables quantum computers to process information more rapidly and with greater accuracy than their classical counterparts.

 Point/Section2: Reversal of a Linked List 
 
To reverse a linkedlist, one must commence a traversal from the head of the list. During the course of the traversal, each node encountered should have its link field modified such that it alludes to the previous node in the sequence. When the end of the linkedlist is reached, the link field of the initial node will need to be updated so as to point back towards the reversed linkedlist.
